intro: Poitea carinalis, commonly known as the carinal poitea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and opposite, ovate leaves with a slightly hairy texture. Its flowers are small and clustered in inflorescences, typically displaying shades of pink or white. Poitea carinalis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories.
